texts.value: Strength has solved all of your problems. There's nothing you can't tough out. Any pain you endure rewards you twice over.
The mystical nature of this world unravels at the snap of your fingers. Some call this intelligence. You call it imagination.
Your dexterity knows no bounds. Knitting a scarf, starting a fire, and killing a man with a bow and arrow. It's all the same.
Quick, silent, and lucky. The only people who remember your face are the ones who see it before entering the gates of heaven.
No one needs to be revived.
Candles must be equipped to rekindle.
Click on the Special tab to see important items

Items in the
"Very Special" slots cannot be moved
Click on the Party tab to see your party's health and mana

Click on a party member's icon for
more details
To equip gear, click the item, and then click the matching slot
To equip a different party member, click their icon in the Party tab
Click on an enemy to attack them
Combat moves to the next character's turn after they act.
The active party member has a bright white square around their icon
Most actions (such as changing gear) are disabled during combat.
Click on the Skill tab, and then click a skill icon to enable it.
Click on an enabled skill to disable it and refund the skill point.
The Info tab shows you the progress you've made through an area

Candles can be equipped just like equipment, providing effects
while usable
Candles have abilities that can be used in combat, but effects are lost when fully used
Items can sold at shops by dragging them to the shopkeeper's inventory
Fighting is something you'll never forget.
"No time to celebrate. Let's keep going."
You two can kill one, but a pack is a different story.

"So you remember how to fight, but not my name?
I guess one is more practical than the other."
There's something oddly charming about a vast expanse full of nothing. Somewhat like a blank canvas.
A few cracks here and there, but you doubt this stone path has ever needed maintenance.
The air feels so empty. If it weren't for the cold breeze every now and then, you'd forget it even existed.
You gaze up at the black sky. It would be more enjoyable if there was a starker contrast between it and the ground.
You've been ambushed. They look hungry.
There was something hiding in the dirt. They attack.
And that's another reason why you need to get home.
You scavenge through their remains for anything useful.
The Unkindled are no match for you.
A bit roughed up, but you can keep going.
You shout loudly and scare them off.
Apparently strong winds created the mounds and swept up entire roads. Folktales are hard to believe.
Sometimes you hear low pitched snarling. At least you think you do.
It must have been difficult laying down rocks in the middle of nowhere. Who built these roads?
You stop at the peaks to look for the flames of Umaria. But you see nothing but more wasteland.
Living in the wastes isn't easy.
The hills are slowing you down. You've been followed.
Best not to linger here for too long.
You scavenge through their remains for anything useful.
The rugged terrain has made them tough. You're tougher.
The hobgoblin points at the Umaria banner before collapsing.
It was brave enough to fight you, but not brave enough to run.
You've avenged a foolish warrior at the cost of another.
It plants its sword in the ground one last time. A sign of respect?
The Unkindled must find your looks unnerving.
You shout loudly and scare them off.

Rivers replaced with dirt. Cattle replaced with Unkindled. 
Clouds replaced with nothing.
An occasional strong wind kicks the dirt up. Covering your mouth and shielding your eyes, you continue walking aimlessly.
All of this for your sister. Is this worth it?
You've been lost, and now you've been found.
If only there was somewhere to hide.
The Unkindled aren't the only ones who can kill.
You'll die if you stay out here.
"The fresh carcasses will draw more Unkindled."
The Unkindled are sensitive to heat and sound. They'll find you again.
You kick up some dirt and run.
A gust of wind throws off their senses.
You're not the only one who's afraid to die.
With the alpha dead, the pack scatters.
Their leader is no more. And neither is their home.
They greyhides were ruled by strength. But they won't obey you.

This must've been a graveyard at some point.
Were tombs uplifted for this road?
Every step you take chills you to your core.

The sounds of slithering and snarling tell you when to be cautious.
Now if only you could hear ghosts.
Undead or alive, they're all the same.
No one will be offerring a burial for these things.
You won't be joining the dead. Not yet.
"Their gods cursed them. Thats why I don't believe in one."

The hat looks like a child's toy; the staff was the real source of power.
A shame it was destroyed in the fight.

That creature may have been a wizard in a past life.
Probably the second time it died from arrogance.
The hat's worthless, but perhaps the gratitude won't be.
"Thankfully, it was just a lesser wraith."
The surrounding tombs make great hiding spots.
"Did they lose interest? Such strange creatures."
For how long will you be able to run?
They can fight you another time.
You've been lost before in life. Just not in a forgotten graveyard.
You hear someone calling out to you. Have you gone mad?
Violent winds throw you off your feet ever so often.
Why did all these people die?
Will you die cold and alone?
The tragedies of the past haunt you today.
"Their gods didn't save them. Why should we?"
Your life is your most valuable posession. But you'll risk it here.
She's waiting for you. Everyone is.
You're afraid of dying. But you're more afraid of your sister dying.

The hat looks like a child's toy; the staff was the real source of power.
A shame it was destroyed in the fight.

That creature may have been a wizard in a past life.
Probably the second time it died from arrogance.
The hat's worthless, but perhaps the gratitude won't be.
"Thankfully it was just a lesser wraith."
Every tomb is a potential hiding spot. For both you and the Unkindled.
A strong wind knocks them back. You take the chance to run.
You just need to hold out a little longer.
Cowardice? No, if you die now Umaria will fall.

When another lesser wraith tries to remember its past,
it'll take this one's place.
Now its as lifeless as a doll.
Your friends...will you see them again?
There was no where to hide.
Its very dark. The sky has always been dark.

A small pond filled with a strange black substance.
It all lies still before you.
There's a series of black puddles, each smaller than the last.
Someone in a cloak is standing before you.
"Get down!" There's a lone greyhide over the hill. It didn't see you.
Peaking over the hills, you spot the start of the path.
You see a bag dropped by someone wandering the wastes.

Looks like you're not the only human walking these roads today.
Seems to be trader of some sort.
A lonely outpost is standing in the distance.
There's a fork in the road.
The Grey Wastes were aptly named. Only a fool would travel these lands. Looks like this is the start of the path.
The road is divided by mountainous hills. These paths will never cross.
There's a recently used outpost nearby. Unkindled might be close.
Stingers paralyze their prey and store them for later in burrows. There might be something useful. There might be someone home.
You find what was left after their last meal. Something shiny caught your eye deeper in. Is it worth the risk?
Larger tombs represent mass burials. Make a prayer?
Smarter goblins band together and stash whatever they find by some rocks. There doesn't seem to be anyone home.
There's a large amount of copper scraps in the pile. The sounds of the metal clinking together could alert nearby goblins.
The path has ended. An endless desert is all that stands between you and Umaria. This won't be easy.
"Hey Holst. Do you think...we'll get out of here?"
Unkindled aren't very wasteful. Maybe there's still something here?
A violent storm of dirt will be passing over you soon.
A large rock blocks the road.
A large rock blocks the road.
A large rock blocks the road.
You stand inside a crude bunker. In front of you, a large goblin sits on a stone throne. Unlike most of their kind, it looks brave.
An undetected pack of greyhides wandered close to you. You dive behind the nearest mound. Did they hear you?

By some miracle you've found an outpost.
With no maintenance, it has succumbed to its time in the wastes.

The alpha fatally wounded you.
 Flaytz is unconcious. You'll be dead soon.
Large packs of greyhides will dig out dens beside areas with lots of food. Only the strongest greyhides can maintain these dens.

Hundreds of spinals are conglomerating together in the form
of a giant archway.
A lesser wraith drifts towards you. Is that...a mouth?

You've found the thief. The wizard's hat really upped its ego.
Seems like it wants to fight everything it sees.

Its the same wraith from before.
"Hey, did you get the hat?"
You've walked into a nest of strangleheads. They haven't seen you yet. They are moving...strangely.

It seems whoever built this road was unable to keep going.
Gravestones litter the wasteland.
The world that existed before The Kindling worshipped gods whose names were lost to history. There seems to be an offering on this altar.
Your aimless walking has drawn you to this enormous tombstone. Perhaps something was calling you here. Maybe the path is near?

Just as you turn to leave, a deafening screech fills the sky.
The doll is gone. Cries echo behind you. "Doll? FRIENDS?".

The wraith's spell has lost its effect. But the battle has
grieviously injured you. Flaytz is barely standing.
You limp back on to the path.

Whatever the wraith's intentions were,
it did bring you to your goal. Hurry.

A lamp post. Are your eyes playing tricks on you?
These need constant maintenance. Umaria is close.
The last battle was too much. The blood from your wounds soaks through your clothes. As long as the vial is unscathed...
You see it. Umaria. The last of humanity's strongholds. Your body is barely moving. But the candle light. The light of her eyes.
You collapse at the gate. You hear a lot of shouting. The gate opening. Someone crying. And then nothing.
A giant gulp of air fills your lungs. You're cold.

Your body fills with sensation as it braces against the world.
Why are you here?

Your memory is fuzzy. How did you get here? You feel terrible.
This place is terrible. Did someone bring you here? No...

You came here because you wanted to.
And now you're lying flat on your back in the middle of nowhere.
Its starting to come back to you. This place...this is The Grey Wastes.

The liquid looks so soft to touch. There's no life in the pool,
though the statue depicts some kind of figure.

You remember coming here. For something. Something special.
Is it still on you?

A bottle containing the strange liquid is still on you.
Wasn't there more?.

These puddles, while irregular, seem to have been placed meticulously,
like a trail of bread crumbs.
While completely lost and alone, you're still alive, for now at least.

The footprints on the ground are fresh, and don't match your boots.
Is someone else here?
No wait, you didn't come here alone. Did she go this way?
"Hey Holst. I see the cure worked on you as well."
"Oh so you drag me out here, get us lost in the middle of nowhere, knocked unconcious, and now you can't even remember who I am?!"

"Look, I'm sorry. My mind was also hazy when I first woke up.
What is important is we get home."
"I got tired of waiting for you to get up and tried to look for the road. The hills over there look a little familiar."

Its an Unkindled.
Vicious creatures that evolved knowing nothing of warmth.

"Greyhides normally travel in packs. This one might've strayed.
It'll be fairly easy to kill right now."
"The weapons we brought with us were damaged while we were out. Not sure what good they'll do us but they're something."

"I don't have any on me. Whatever attacked us earlier stole them.
I think we'll be okay."

"The road should take us back to Umaria.
If we can get there in time we will save everyone."

"I looked for the others. That bottle might be the only one we get.
But if we can prove the cure exists it should be enough."

"Your memory loss must've been worse than mine.
Its a side effect of the cure. I wonder when you'll remember me."
"Finally. Well, I've been feeling better after drinking some of that mysterious goop. Let's get going."
Whoever left this won't be needing it anymore.
"Interested? Let me know if something catches your eye."
"A lot of these goods are for the folk in Epoc. I'll see what I can spare."

"Most merchants avoid carrying candles out into the wastes.
Just don't light them near me, alright?"
"Grey coats are the safest thing to wear out here. Makes it harder for bandits to spot you. Not much good against Unkindled though."
"Your lot doesn't look well. Don't come too close now."

"Lord Ashpod is known for his obstinance.
Its why this trade route is still running."
"To think humanity once covered most of this land. Ah well, Lord Ashpod doesn't pay us for thinking. Are you buying something?"
"I wouldn't recommend going to Umaria right now."
"Queen Era has been deathly ill. Many are fleeing Umaria fearing its the same plague that wiped out Fort Eons."

"You're heading to Umaria? You can cut across
those hills over there to save some time. But why now?"

"I'm heading south to Epoc so I can't really guide you.
But I can loan you some rations for the road. Stay safe."
The warmth is rejuvenating. Its as if your youth has returned to you.
The magic of the fire can bring anyone back from the brink.

While larger candles recharge on their own,
smaller ones seem to need a little help.
The fire is nice. But you can't help but feel watched.
There's no rest for the wicked.
How long will you stay concious for this time?
Who would pass on a free meal?
Pray they last longer this time.
Perhaps this is the right way?
Although your memory alludes you, this feels like the wrong way.

"I know my memory isn't that great right now either,
but I think this is the way."

You might be lost. Well as long as you have the road,
it shouldn't be too bad.
You can't quite remember, but this path feels familiar.
You don't remember going this way. No time for hesitations though.
This has to be the right path. You're almost sure of it.
"Was this the way we came? Did we even come this way?"
You lie quietly against the dirt and pray. After a moment you look back. The pack is walking away.
You try to hide but they hear your movements. They attack.
Sometimes you just can't take risks.
You found nothing. The stingers found you.
Only a stinger's eyes can shine inside their burrow.
You grabbed everything you could. Should probably leave now.
You found nothing. Not the worst outcome.
The tomb resonates. You feel better.
Nothing happened. A waste of time.
The stone lights up. There's something lying at your feet.
The tomb glows. An oddly shaped charm is hanging around Flaytz's neck.
You wait a bit but nothing happens. Maybe your prayers will be answered in the afterlife.
The stone shimmers. There's a cloak wrapped around you.
The tomb flashes white. A wraith's cloak falls before Flaytz.
No one protected the wraiths. Why should they protect you?
A cold wind passes over you. A sign that you should probably leave.
The markings on the tomb start to glow. Something is in your pockets.
The tomb emits some kind of light. Oddly shaped coins are in your hands.

You idle at the rock. Your prayers have gone unanswered.
Flaytz is unphased. "Not the first time this has happened."

The pile is worthless, but you notice
 its sitting on top of some good condition rags.
You inspect the goblin's crude hut, only to see a pile of garbage.
You sift through their pile and find a lot of useful trinkets.
There's a bit of meat left behind. Probably not the best to eat.
Some of the bones might be of use.
You brace against the current and slowly move forward. Any experience that does not kill you makes you stronger, right?
You attempt to stand your ground, but the wind is too much. A strong gust picks you off your feet and carries you with the storm.

You're not strong enough to brave the storm.
Dirt, rocks, and remains pelt you to the ground
This storm isn't the worst. It passes over you peacefully.

The sky turns grey as you're consumed by dust and dirt.
The winds are furious and drag you in their direction.

You find a small hill and lay flat against it.
Soon enough, you can see the sky again.
You push the rock with all of your might and move it off the road. An experience that will help future travelers.

You push with all of your strength against the rock,
but all you do is waste time.

The rock is too suspicious. Leave it to someone
with more time on their hands to move it out of the way.

With your keen intellect, you are able to discern
that it is just an ordinary rock.
You glance at the rock from a distance, but fail to notice anything.
You go to push the rock. While giving it your all, a group of goblins appear from behind it and claw at you.
You go to walk around the rock. Right as you step off the path, a band of goblins jump up from behind it and pelt you with rocks.

"There's subtle claw markings on the rock.
Goblins are probably hiding for an ambush."
You glance at the rock from a distance, but fail to notice anything.

You take a running start and leap over the rock.
The goblins are startled.
You shove the rock over to the side of the road. There's a hole leading to some rudimentary bunker.

The rock is surprisingly heavy. Even with your best efforts,
it doesn't budge. You're wasting time.
She needs you right now. Get going.

There's nothing special about the rock.
However, the ground beneath it seems unnatural.
You glance at the rock from a distance, but fail to notice anything.
Other goblins rush to stand by their champion.
"This outpost has been damaged. Its not going to be of much use."
The flame flickers as it saps the candle of its dwindling strength to recover yours.
Even when eroded to nothing, a candle can still perform miracles.

"There's probably a really strong greyhide in there.
Together, I think we stand a chance."
Flaytz smiles. "It wouldn't be fair if you died helping me search for a cure I read in a chronicle. Let's go home already."
The archway glows green as it showers you with vigor.
As you walk through, the spinals begin to move faster and faster. Halfway through, they strike the path with lightning.
"My father would go on for hours about what its like travelling underneath the sea. Maybe this is similar."

"Knowing you Holst, I bet you find something
terribly beautiful about this no one else could."

The archway extends for nearly a kilometer.
Trudging off the path will take a while.
While this archway is rather short, the bursts of electricity from the spinals cover quite the area.

Many of the spinals watch you as you walk past them.
Old folktales claim they long for connection.
Hunters have died for the healing properties the spinal's fluid possesses. You cautiously dip your hands in.
Your weak mind connects with the Spinals as you touch the arch. Terrible screams of agony flood your senses. You jump back in shock.
The little wraith vanishes as you ready to strike.
Best kill it now before it becomes a wraith.

"So many freeze and run when they see me.
All I'm looking for is my hat."

"You'll help me? Well, some low-life stole my wizard's hat.
If you can get it back for me, I'll try to help ya out."
"I A- T-E GR--T-ST! F-T-ER Y-- WI-L B- PR--D!"
"Ah there's my hat. Thanks a lot!"
"You killed the bastard and then lost my hat? Ugh...just leave me alone."

"Oh? You didn't know we could talk? All of us can. 
We just don't remember how right away. Takes a long time."

"Yeah, I knew the hat was fake. Some kid dropped it on the road 
a while back. But something about it feels familiar to me..."

"Sorry buddy, I'm not much of a guide. Here, I'll give you this instead.
Some of us have these things. Not sure why."

You creep past the strangleheads until
the sounds of their slithering are no more.
They're too erratic. You can't avoid them.
With all of your strength, you cleave off their heads in one mighty blow.

It takes a lot of strength to cut through their thick necks.
A shame you didn't realize sooner.
Thinking back to your studies, you realize the strangleheads are performing a boisterous dance. Most likely to secure a mate.

You continue observing their movements,
but can't make out what they are.
With all your energy, you two bend and weave through the strangleheads. They seem amused, or at least aroused.
Dancing was never your strong suit.

You take the strange candle. Even if their gods were real,
they don't seem to mind your sacrilege.

Moments after stealing the candle, a strange pulse chills your spine.
You feel drained.
While ancient altars are rare, the candle sitting in front of you is like nothing you've ever seen.

The candle is untouched by dirt and dust.
When was this placed here?

"I can't recall ever seeing a candle made of white wax.
Who made this?"

The gods before The Kindling are a lot kinder than today's.
You feel empowered.
"Holst, ancient deities won't save Era. But we can."
A lone doll hangs from a string attached...somewhere?
You check behind the stone. Nothing is holding up the doll. We need to leave this mystery behind. But something compels you to stay.

Flaytz agonizes. "My head hurts. H-Holst, we need to go!"
But the doll is calling you. What does it say?
You put your ear up close to the doll. You can almost hear it whispering, "Friend?". You have to leave.
"I doubt we'll be home any time soon."
"I still can't believe that place existed."
"Its all so dull and grey. Reminds me of you."
"I mean I've spent so much time reading the sagas, epics, and legends kept in Umaria's library. Never thought I'd ever see what I read."

"That statue? It wasn't described in the books.
Maybe it was an ancient relic from before The Kindling?"
"Figured I'd lighten the mood with a joke or two. Didn't think you'd forget your sense of humour. Not that you had one to begin with."

"Its just been goblins and stray greyhides.
We haven't run into anything dangerous like a hobgoblin."
"Whatever attacked us left us alive. Thats not something Unkindled usually do."
"I really am not cut out for this."
"I'd hate to be a merchant working for Lord Asphod."

"Try not to talk too much.
Most Unkindled have poor eye sight but amazing hearing."

"This is actually really fun. I just wish,"
Flaytz takes a deep breath, "there were less hills."

Flaytz seems to be out of breath. She wasn't trained
to be a soldier like most people.

"What can I do? Your sister didn't abolish the yearly quotas,
and my mother was a scholar."

"It's not your fault. I just hate my life. Not being able to
go out and explore the world. All I can do is read."
"All they ever do is see the same landscape. The same boring grey. The same empty sky. All while hiding from the same heartless brutes."
Flaytz goes off. "...can't even get horses to help them cause they'd just attract more Unkindled! It must be the worst job in the land."
"So drawing Umaria's vibrant fields has started to bore you? I guess even a flowering meadow looks dull when frozen in time."
"Of course, I know their services are essential for distant villages like Epoc. I just think Ashpod should invest in making a safer road."

"You really should spend more time reading instead of painting.
You'd learn a lot about this world."
Flaytz looks hopeless. "I wonder if this was all for nothing."

"I really, really, don't think we came through here.
But its too late to turn back."

"We're in the middle of nowhere, with little food and water.
Its only a matter of time before some stinger picks us off."
"I know, I know. I'm not giving up...I just like to be realistic. Sorry."

"Everyone knows of my father's great adventures.
But no one knows how he died. Holst, can you guess?"

"His final expedition was to map out Faela's Labyrinth.
He probably died lost and alone."

"Queen Era's really lucky to have you as a brother,
even if you are a bastard."

"Haha. Thanks for being honest.
At least if we die, we die together, right?"

"I should have listened to Fran. If his time magic couldn't slow down
the plague, what good can I do?"
"It's like a road to some graveyard."
"As creepy as all of this is, I actually kind of like it...an adventure."

"They've apparently existed since The Kindling.
The spell keeping them alive must've traumatized them."

"So you're not phased by ghostly spines floating in some
magical healing jelly? Holst, you're pretty weird."

"Some display higher levels of thought,
others drift around waiting to attack anything warm."
"Fran tried to study them in the past. The second you remove the cloth the shadow underneath fades."
"Its just two eyes staring from underneath some fabric older than the kingdom. Don't you wonder how that happens?"

"Extremely rare ones show abilities to speak.
They're really different from normal Unkindled."

"Well "lesser" wraith would be more approrpiate.
A real wraith is way too dangerous to be kept alive."

"I forgot you're not the curious type.
I'll add that to the list of things I remembered."
"We're travelling through an unmapped land equal parts danger and mystery," Flaytz sighs. "If only I could've been a cartographer like him..."

"Serving as a nameless artist in the queen's court
isn't much fun for you, I'm sure."

"Sure beats spending hours studying and
writing papers on things I'll never see."
"To think an entire civilization once stood here. Kind of haunting."
"I get that you don't read much Holst, but you remember why these gravestones are here right?"
"I don't want to die out here."
"When entire nations were dying out, many buried their dead and made prayers for peace in the afterlife."
"Whatever gods they prayed to twisted their prayers, and now we have lesser wraiths, floating arms, and other abominations."
"Some kind of echoing off in the distance. But I think its all in my head. Whatever, lets keep going."

She looks entranced. "Normally I'd feel pretty lost right now.
But there's some voice guiding me right now."
"Were you always so optimistic? I can't remember. But I appreciate it."

"Your sister's life matters a lot to you huh?
I wish Fran cared about me that much."

"Well he won't be marrying me for my face anymore.
All he needs is for me to study his "legendary" chronomancy."
Greaty increases physical traits and slightly increase accuracy
Greatly increases magical traits and slightly increases of accuracy
Increases physical traits, accuracy, and decides turn order
Increases magical traits, dodge, and critical chance, among other things
Increases damage dealt by physical attacks
Increases damage dealt by magical attacks
Reduces damage taken by physical attacks
Reduces damage taken by magical attacks
Rating of how precise this character's attacks are
Reduces accuracy of attacks on this character

Percentage chance of doing
extra damage
Inside it is the fabled cure. This is the reason you're here.
It has no magical properties whatsoever. Probably fake.

Restore half of
the user's MP

Restore half of
the user's HP
Something you can't afford to lose
This skill will be visible once there is at least one skill enabled in the previous column
Travel through The Grey Wastes to Umaria
Return the Talking Lesser Wraith's hat.
Magical attack with a high chance to burn
Draw an enemy's attention and anger towards yourself
Damage taken from random events is halved
Restore 25% of physical damage dealt as MP
Increase the PDEF of anyone in the party
Increases PATK by 30%, but your attacks now cost HP

Weak magical attack with a decent chance
to freeze
Mana regeneration while travelling is doubled
Burn chance on attacks is doubled
Restore HP to a party member with a decent chance to regenerate

Candle uses are doubled, but unequipping removes
all uses

Gain Advantage for 1 turn at the start
of combat

Items have a 50% higher chance of dropping
from enemies
Physical attack with a high chance to poison
Damage from poison and bleed is reduced by 50%
Restore HP to a party member and cure them

Weak physical attack that also hits
adjacent enemies
Magical attack with a high chance to stun
Wax obtained from enemies is increased by 50%
Increase DOG by 15 or 15% (whichever is greater)
Gain Advantage for 1 turn whenever an enemy is stunned
Magical attack with a decent chance to shock
Taking 30% of caster's MATK as magic damage at the end of its turn
Losing 8% of its max HP at the end of its turn
Has PATK increased by 50% and must attack the caster when it can
Has DOG, ACC, and PDEF reduced by 30%
HP is being drained equal to 40% of caster's PATK at the end of its turn
HP is being drained equal to 70% of caster's PATK at the end of its turn
Has CRIT increased by a flat 50%
Has DOG decreased by 50% and takes double damage from burns
Takes 50% more damage from magical attacks

Unable to act on
its next turn
Recovering 5% of its HP at the end of its turn
Debuffs on this character last half as long
Fleeing from combat is very unlikely
Has PDEF and MDEF increased by 9999
Losing 30% of its max HP at the end of its turn
Has HP increased by 66% and recovers 5% of its HP at the end of its turn
Has PATK increased by 50% and HP increased by 33%
Has MATK increased by 50% and HP increased by 33%
Has PDEF increased by 50% and HP increased by 33%
Has MDEF increased by 50% and HP increased by 33%
Damage from poison is reduced by 50%
Curious wanderers of the wastes. Who knows where it found its clothes.
Goblin that was inspired by the warrior it killed.
They like to hunt in packs, preying on the weakest.
Its eyes reflect what little light there is to lure in prey.
Malevolent souls of those who died under false promises.
A lesser wraith an increased affinity for magic.
Regretful spirit that failed to let go of the past.
Reanimated arm that became as cursed as the spirit that took control of it.
Feral beasts that live for the smell of blood.
A single bite and they can siphon off all of a victim's blood.
Ghastly embodiment of someone's nervous system before death.
It coils around its meals to prevent their escape.
All it takes to be their alpha is brute strength and a bit more brain.
